description: From Latin dētrītus (“(that which is) rubbed away”), from dēterō (“rub away”).

nouns.description: detritus (usually uncountable, plural detritus or detrita)

entries.meaning: (countable, chiefly geology) Pieces of rock broken off by ice, glacier, or erosion.
(biology, ecology) Organic waste material from decomposing dead plants or animals.
(by extension) Any debris or fragments of disintegrated material.
